result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan J Weiss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan J Weiss was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Defendant must not commit any criminal violations, and shall successfully complete probation on 14CF322.  Upon successful completion, this count to be amended to Misd. Bail Jumping w/costs of $443.00.

supervisions.notes: 3 days credit if revoked from probation.

miscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED.
Cooperate and complete any AODA treatment and/or aftercare programming deemed necessary by DOC.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with E5511  50th Ave, Durand, WI.  May not vote until civil rights are restored.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Must cooperate and complete MRT programming.

timeConds.notes: 3 days credit if revoked from probation.  Huber allowed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
